Fact: The boom in scientific discoveries and advancements in technology inspired many artists to think about the future in 2000. Robots were imagined to do unproductive work of everyday life such as: vacuum cleaning. grooming. washing floor. washing clothes and cooking food. However these robots have only managed some of these tasks.

Vacuum cleaning robots are very successful than most other domestic robot. Millions of vacuum cleaning robots have already been sold and the number is increasing rapidly. They are advanced enough to reach every corner of the home for cleaning without human assistance. They can recharge themselves and have other features included using wifi functions.

The Robotic industry was developing in the 1980s and the public could purchase robotic toys for kids. These toy robots were equipped with microcontrollers that guided robots how to walk dance and sing. Today these same robots are more sophisticated and can actually respond to kids. Imagine that.

Humanoid robots are the most anticipated kind of robots. Engineers have been working on many complex problems to make this humanoid robot successful. Some of the main problems were computer vision artificial intelligence balancing systems and battery timing. One of the most advanced humanoid robot - Honda's ASIMO Has an excellent balancing system on feet with human like legs. It's complex ai program installed can interact with humans and avoid obstacles while walking.

George Devol and Joseph Engelberger in 1959 became the first people to make a company called Unimation they designed and manufacted industrial robots. They introduced the first industrial robot to industries. The industrial robots are used for the specialized task in the industries to be performed autonomously.
